Description: Tall ribbed pottery jar of red siltware, with a pointed base and convex sides, which converge to the rim. There are two small loop handles at the sides on the upper part of the body.
Curator's comments: This vessel was used as a container for the burial of mummified ibises.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1977 / Egyptian objects in the Victoria and Albert Museum (p.27)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
